The issue is that the production environment at `/opt/comserv/Comserv/` is missing the `Comserv.pm` file in the `lib` directory.\n\nBased on the error logs you provided, the problem is clear:\n\n1. **Production path**: `/opt/comserv/Comserv/`\n2. **Error**: `Can't locate Comserv.pm in @INC`\n3. **@INC includes**: `/opt/comserv/Comserv/lib` (which should contain `Comserv.pm`)\n\nThe solution is to ensure that the `Comserv.pm` file exists in the production server's `/opt/comserv/Comserv/lib/` directory.\n\nLet me create a deployment script to help you fix this issue:"},{"type":"toolCall","toolCallId":"toolu_01VHRFdp8YCvNcZVaX8gfvY3","statusText":"Change generated","status":"SUCCESS","context":{"files":[{"path":"fix_production_deployment.sh","fsPath":"/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/fix_production_deployment.sh"}]},"isHidden":false},{"type":"codeHunk","lineBasedDiff":"--- fix_production_deployment.sh\n+++ fix_production_deployment.sh\n@@ -0,0 +1,128 @@\n+#!/bin/bash\n+\n+# Fix Production Deployment Script\n+# This script addresses the \"Can't locate Comserv.pm\" issue in production\n+\n+echo \"=== Comserv Production Deployment Fix ===\"\n+echo \"This script will help fix the missing Comserv.pm issue in production\"\n+echo \"\"\n+\n+# Define paths\n+PRODUCTION_PATH=\"/opt/comserv/Comserv\"\n+DEV_PATH=\"/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv\"\n+\n+echo \"Production path: $PRODUCTION_PATH\"\n+echo \"Development path: $DEV_PATH\"\n+echo \"\"\n+\n+# Check if we're running this on the production server\n+if [ -d \"$PRODUCTION_PATH\" ]; then\n+ echo \" Production directory found: $PRODUCTION_PATH\"\n+ \n+ # Check if lib directory exists\n+ if [ ! -d \"$PRODUCTION_PATH/lib\" ]; then\n+ echo \" Missing lib directory in production\"\n+ echo \"Creating lib directory...\"\n+ mkdir -p \"$PRODUCTION_PATH/lib\"\n+ echo \" Created lib directory\"\n+ else\n+ echo \" lib directory exists\"\n+ fi\n+ \n+ # Check if Comserv.pm exists in lib\n+ if [ ! -f \"$PRODUCTION_PATH/lib/Comserv.pm\" ]; then\n+ echo \" Missing Comserv.pm in production lib directory\"\n+ \n+ # Check if we have the development version available\n+ if [ -f \"$DEV_PATH/lib/Comserv.pm\" ]; then\n+ echo \" Found development version of Comserv.pm\"\n+ echo \"Copying Comserv.pm to production...\"\n+ cp \"$DEV_PATH/lib/Comserv.pm\" \"$PRODUCTION_PATH/lib/\"\n+ echo \" Copied Comserv.pm to production\"\n+ else\n+ echo \" Development version not found at $DEV_PATH/lib/Comserv.pm\"\n+ echo \"Please ensure the development environment is properly set up\"\n+ exit 1\n+ fi\n+ else\n+ echo \" Comserv.pm exists in production lib directory\"\n+ fi\n+ \n+ # Check if Comserv directory structure exists in lib\n+ if [ ! Placing deployment scripts inside the Git repository can indeed cause issues with future pulls and branch changes. Let me explain the best practices and create a better solution.\n\n## The Problem with In-Repo Deployment Scripts\n\nWhen you put deployment scripts inside the Git repository:\n1. **Merge conflicts** can occur if the script is modified in different branches\n2. **Pull operations** might fail if the script has local modifications\n3. **Branch switching** can overwrite local deployment configurations\n4. **Security concerns** - deployment scripts often contain sensitive paths/credentials\n\n## Better Approach: External Deployment\n\nLet me create a deployment script that should be placed **outside** the Git repository:"},{"type":"toolCall","toolCallId":"toolu_01PeCtB2QYkYxES5CCisXC6h","statusText":"Change generated","status":"SUCCESS","context":{"files":[{"path":"external_deploy_comserv.sh","fsPath":"/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/external_deploy_comserv.sh"}]},"isHidden":false},{"type":"codeHunk","lineBasedDiff":"--- external_deploy_comserv.sh\n+++ external_deploy_comserv.sh\n@@ -0,0 +1,235 @@\n+#!/bin/bash\n+\n+# External Comserv Deployment Script\n+# \n+# IMPORTANT: This script should be placed OUTSIDE the Git repository\n+# Recommended location: /opt/scripts/deploy_comserv.sh\n+# \n+# Usage:\n+# sudo /opt/scripts/deploy_comserv.sh\n+#\n+# This script:\n+# 1. Pulls latest code from Git to production\n+# 2. Creates environment-specific files (PSGI, configs)\n+# 3. Restarts services\n+# 4. Doesn't interfere with Git operations\n+\n+set -e # Exit on any error\n+\n+# =============================================================================\n+# CONFIGURATION - Modify these for your environment\n+# =============================================================================\n+\n+PRODUCTION_PATH=\"/opt/comserv/Comserv\"\n+REPO_URL=\"origin\" # Your Git remote name\n+BRANCH=\"master\" # Deployment branch\n+SERVICE_NAME=\"starman\" # Service to restart\n+\n+# Optional: Git repository URL (if you need to clone fresh)\n+# GIT_REPO_URL=\"https://github.com/yourusername/comserv.git\"\n+\n+# =============================================================================\n+# SCRIPT LOGIC - Don't modify below unless you know what you're doing\n+# =============================================================================\n+\n+# Colors for output\n+RED='\\033[0;31m'\n+GREEN='\\033[0;32m'\n+YELLOW='\\033[1;33m'\n+BLUE='\\033[0;34m'\n+NC='\\033[0m' # No Color\n+\n+print_status() { echo -e \"${GREEN}${NC} $1\"; }\n+print_warning() { echo -e \"${YELLOW}${NC} $1\"; }\n+print_error() { echo -e \"${RED}${NC} $1\"; }\n+print_info() { echo -e \"${BLUE}${NC} $1\"; }\n+\n+echo \"=== External Comserv Deployment Script ===\"\n+echo \"Production Path: $PRODUCTION_PATH\"\n+echo \"Branch: $BRANCH\"\n+echo \"\"\n+\n+# Check if running with appropriate permissions\n+if [[ $EUID -ne 0 ]]; then\n+ print_error \"This script must be run as root or with sudo\"\n+ echo \"Usage: sudo $0\"\n+ exit 1\n+fi\n+\n+# Step 1: Backup current deployment (optional)\n+echo \"--- Step 1: Creating Backup ---\"\n+BACKUP_DIR=\"/opt/backups/comserv/$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)\"\n+if [ -d \"$PRODUCTION_PATH\" ]; then\n+ print_info \"Creating backup at $BACKUP_DIR\"\n+ mkdir -p \"$BACKUP_DIR\"\n+ cp -r \"$PRODUCTION_PATH\" \"$BACKUP_DIR/\" 2>/dev/null || print_warning \"Backup failed (non-critical)\"\n+ print_status \"Backup created\"\n+else\n+ print_info \"No existing deployment to backup\"\n+fi\n+\n+# Step 2: Ensure production directory exists\n+echo \"\"\n+echo \"--- Step 2: Preparing Production Directory ---\"\n+if [ ! -d \"$PRODUCTION_PATH\" ]; then\n+ print_warning \"Production directory doesn't exist, creating it\"\n+ mkdir -p \"$PRODUCTION_PATH\"\n+ print_status \"Created $PRODUCTION_PATH\"\n+fi\n+\n+cd \"$PRODUCTION_PATH\"\n+\n+# Step 3: Handle Git repository\n+echo \"\"\n+echo \"--- Step 3: Git Repository Management ---\"\n+if [ ! -d \".git\" ]; then\n+ print_warning \"Not a Git repository\"\n+ if [ -n \"$GIT_REPO_URL\" ]; then\n+ print_info \"Cloning repository from $GIT_REPO_URL\"\n+ cd /opt/comserv\n+ rm -rf Comserv # Remove empty directory\n+ git clone \"$GIT_REPO_URL\" Comserv\n+ cd Comserv\n+ print_status \"Repository cloned\"\n+ else\n+ print_error \"Production directory is not a Git repository\"\n+ echo \"Please either:\"\n+ echo \"1. Set GIT_REPO_URL in this script and run again\"\n+ echo \"2. then\n+ print_info \"Creating production PSGI file...\"\n+ cat > comserv.psgi << 'EOF'\n+#!/usr/bin/env perl\n+\n+use strict;\n+use warnings;\n+use FindBin;\n+use lib \"$FindBin::Bin/lib\";\n+\n+# Set up local::lib for local installations\n+use local::lib \"$FindBin::Bin/local\";\n+\n+# Load the Comserv application\n+use Comserv;\n+\n+# Production environment settings\n+$ENV{CATALYST_DEBUG} ||= 0;\n+$ENV{COMSERV_ENV} = 'production';\n+\n+# Return the PSGI application\n+Comserv->psgi_app;\n+EOF\n+ chmod 755 comserv.psgi\n+ print_status \"Created comserv.psgi\"\n+else\n+ print_status \"comserv.psgi already exists\"\n+fi\n+\n+# Create production database config if it doesn't exist\n+if [ ! -f \"db_config.json\" ]; then\n+ print_warning \"db_config.json missing - you'll need to create this manually\"\n+ echo \"Example db_config.json structure needed in $PRODUCTION_PATH/\"\n+fi\n+\n+# Step 6: Verify critical files\n+echo \"\"\n+echo \"--- Step 6: Verifying Application ---\"\n+\n+# Check main module\n+if [ -f \"lib/Comserv.pm\" ]; then\n+ print_status \"lib/Comserv.pm exists\"\n+else\n+ print_error \"lib/Comserv.pm missing - check Git repository\"\n+ exit 1\n+fi\n+\n+# Check module directory\n+if [ -d \"lib/Comserv\" ]; then\n+ print_status \"lib/Comserv/ directory exists\"\n+else\n+ print_error \"lib/Comserv/ directory missing\"\n+ exit 1\n+fi\n+\n+# Test PSGI syntax\n+print_info \"Testing PSGI syntax...\"\n+if perl -c comserv.psgi >/dev/null 2>&1; then\n+ print_status \"PSGI syntax OK\"\n+else\n+ print_error \"PSGI syntax error\"\n+ perl -c comserv.psgi # Show the error\n+ exit 1\n+fi\n+\n+# Step 7: Set permissions\n+echo \"\"\n+echo \"--- Step 7: Setting Permissions ---\"\n+chown -R www-data:www-data \"$PRODUCTION_PATH\" 2>/dev/null || {\n+ print_warning \"Could not set www-data ownership\"\n+}\n+chmod -R 755 \"$PRODUCTION_PATH\"\n+chmod 644 lib/Comserv.pm\n+chmod 755 comserv.psgi\n+print_status \"Permissions set\"\n+\n+# Step 8: Restart services\n+echo \"\"\n+echo \"--- Step 8: Restarting Services ---\"\n+if systemctl is-active --quiet \"$SERVICE_NAME\" 2>/dev/null; then\n+ print_info \"Restarting $SERVICE_NAME...\"\n+ systemctl restart \"$SERVICE_NAME\"\n+ sleep 3\n+ if systemctl is-active --quiet \"$SERVICE_NAME\"; then\n+ print_status \"$SERVICE_NAME restarted successfully\"\n+ else\n+ print_error \"$SERVICE_NAME failed to start\"\n+ echo \"Check logs: journalctl -u $SERVICE_NAME -f\"\n+ exit 1\n+ fi\n+else\n+ print_warning \"$SERVICE_NAME not running or not found\"\n+ echo \"Try: systemctl start $SERVICE_NAME\"\n+fi\n+\n+# Step 9: Final verification\n+echo \"\"\n+echo \"--- Step 9: Deployment Verification ---\"\n+print_status \"Deployment completed successfully!\"\n+echo \"\"\n+echo \"Deployed components:\"\n+echo \" Application code (from Git)\"\n+echo \" Production PSGI file\"\n+echo \" Proper permissions\"\n+echo \" Service restart\"\n+echo \"\"\n+echo \"Monitoring commands:\"\n+echo \" systemctl status $SERVICE_NAME\"\n+echo \" journalctl -u $SERVICE_NAME -f\"\n+echo \" tail -f $PRODUCTION_PATH/logs/application.log\"\n+echo \"\"\n+print_info \"Backup location: $BACKUP_DIR\"","refToolCallId":"toolu_01PeCtB2QYkYxES5CCisXC6h"},{"type":"text","text":"Now let me create a simple instruction file for proper deployment setup:"},{"type":"toolCall","toolCallId":"toolu_01DX3AkmLR6rwH3ES8WTw9X4","statusText":"Change generated","status":"SUCCESS","context":{"files":[{"path":"DEPLOYMENT_SETUP.md","fsPath":"/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/DEPLOYMENT_SETUP.md"}]},"isHidden":false},{"type":"codeHunk","lineBasedDiff":"--- DEPLOYMENT_SETUP.md\n+++ DEPLOYMENT_SETUP.md\n@@ -0,0 +1,102 @@\n+# Comserv Production Deployment Setup\n+\n+## The Problem\n+Your production server is missing the `Comserv.pm` module because:\n+1. The PSGI file is correctly ignored by Git (environment-specific)\n+2. But the deployment process isn't properly pulling the latest code\n+3. Environment-specific files need to be created on production\n+\n+## Proper Deployment Setup\n+\n+### Step 1: Set up External Deployment Script\n+\n+**On your production server**, create the deployment script OUTSIDE the Git repository:\n+\n+```bash\n+# Create scripts directory\n+sudo mkdir -p /opt/scripts\n+\n+# Copy the deployment script\n+sudo cp external_deploy_comserv.sh /opt/scripts/deploy_comserv.sh\n+sudo chmod +x /opt/scripts/deploy_comserv.sh\n+```\n+\n+### Step 2: Initial Production Setup\n+\n+If `/opt/comserv/Comserv` doesn't exist or isn't a Git repository:\n+\n+```bash\n+# Option A: Clone fresh (recommended)\n+cd /opt/comserv\n+sudo git clone <your-git-repo-url> Comserv\n+\n+# Option B: Initialize existing directory\n+cd /opt/comserv/Comserv\n+sudo git init\n+sudo git remote add origin <your-git-repo-url>\n+sudo git pull origin master\n+```\n+\n+### Step 3: Deploy\n+\n+```bash\n+sudo /opt/scripts/deploy_comserv.sh\n+```\n+\n+## What This Approach Solves\n+\n+### Advantages\n+- **No Git conflicts**: Deployment script is outside the repo\n+- **Environment-specific**: Creates PSGI files per environment\n+- **Safe updates**: Always pulls latest code from Git\n+- **Rollback capability**: Creates backups before deployment\n+- **Service management**: Handles service restarts\n+\n+### File Management\n+- **In Git**: `lib/Comserv.pm`, all application code\n+- **Not in Git**: `comserv.psgi`, `db_config.json` (environment-specific)\n+- **External**: Deployment scripts in `/opt/scripts/`\n+\n+## Quick Fix for Current Issue\n+\n+If you need an immediate fix:\n+\n+```bash\n+# On production server\n+cd /opt/comserv/Comserv\n+\n+# Pull latest code\n+sudo git pull origin master\n+\n+# Create PSGI file if missing\n+if [ ! -f comserv.psgi ]; then\n+ sudo tee comserv.psgi > /dev/null << 'EOF'\n+#!/usr/bin/env perl\n+use strict;\n+use warnings;\n+use FindBin;\n+use lib \"$FindBin::Bin/lib\";\n+use local::lib \"$FindBin::Bin/local\";\n+use Comserv;\n+$ENV{CATALYST_DEBUG} ||= 0;\n+Comserv->psgi_app;\n+EOF\n+ sudo chmod 755 comserv.psgi\n+fi\n+\n+# Set permissions\n+sudo chown -R www-data:www-data /opt/comserv/Comserv\n+sudo chmod -R 755 /opt/comserv/Comserv\n+\n+# Test and restart\n+perl -c comserv.psgi && sudo systemctl restart starman\n+```\n+\n+## Ongoing Deployment Workflow\n+\n+1. **Development**: Make changes, commit to Git\n+2. **Push**: `git push origin master`\n+3. **Deploy**: `sudo /opt/scripts/deploy_comserv.sh` on production\n+4. **Monitor**: Check logs and service status\n+\n+This keeps your Git repository clean while ensuring proper production deployments.","refToolCallId":"toolu_01DX3AkmLR6rwH3ES8WTw9X4"},{"type":"text","text":"## Summary\n\nYou're absolutely correct about the deployment script placement issue. Here's the proper solution:\n\n### The Root Cause\n- **PSGI files should stay in `.gitignore`** (environment-specific) \n- **`Comserv.pm` is in Git** (application code) \n- **Production deployment process** needs to handle both \n\n### The Proper Solution\n\n1. **External deployment script**: Place deployment scripts **outside** the Git repository (e.g., `/opt/scripts/deploy_comserv.sh`)\n\n2. **Git for application code**: Use Git to deploy `Comserv.pm` and all application modules\n\n3. **Environment-specific files**: Create PSGI files and configs during deployment (not from Git)\n\n### Immediate Fix for Your Production Issue\n\nRun this on your production server:\n\n```bash\ncd /opt/comserv/Comserv\nsudo git pull origin master # Get latest Comserv.pm\n# Create PSGI file if missing (since it's environment-specific)\nsudo systemctl restart starman\n```\n\n### Long-term Solution\n\n1. Copy `external_deploy_comserv.sh` to `/opt/scripts/deploy_comserv.sh` on your production server\n2. Use `sudo /opt/scripts/deploy_comserv.sh` for all future deployments\n3. The problem is that when you run:\n\n```bash\nstarman --listen :4000 --workers 4 --verbose comserv.psgi\n```\n\nStarman is looking for a file called `app.psgi` by default, but your file is named `comserv.psgi`. The error message shows it's trying to load `/opt/comserv/Comserv/app.psgi` instead of `/opt/comserv/Comserv/comserv.psgi`.\n\n## Solution\n\nYou have two options to fix this:\n\n### Option 1: Specify the correct PSGI file explicitly\nChange your command to explicitly specify the correct PSGI file:\n\n```bash\nstarman --listen :4000 --workers 4 --verbose /opt/comserv/Comserv/comserv.psgi\n```\n\n### Option 2: Create a symbolic link or copy\nCreate an `app.psgi` file that points to or contains the same content as `comserv.psgi`:\n\n```bash\n# Option 2a: Create a symbolic link\nln -s /opt/comserv/Comserv/comserv.psgi /opt/comserv/Comserv/app.psgi\n\n# Option 2b: Copy the file\ncp /opt/comserv/Comserv/comserv.psgi /opt/comserv/Comserv/app.psgi\n```\n\n### Recommended Solution\nI recommend **Option 1** - explicitly specifying the PSGI file path in your command. This is cleaner and avoids file duplication.\n\nSo your corrected command should be:\n```bash\nstarman --listen :4000 --workers 4 --verbose /opt/comserv/Comserv/comserv.psgi\n```\n\nThis will tell Starman exactly which PSGI file to load, resolving the \"No such file or directory\" error."}],"context":{"author":"Coding Agent","operationId":"93d0386e-9017-4886-8e4d-19b0693c12cd"},"createdAt":1750594429152,"isInternal":false},{"id":"f343ec7e-1b11-4148-9e66-14e0ba385da1","role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"That may brack the real starman started at at boot"}],"context":{"currentFile":{"path":"comserv-dev.service","fsPath":"/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/comserv-dev.service","sources":["opened_tab"],"content":"[Unit]\nDescription=Comserv Development Server (Starman)\nAfter=network.target\n\n[Service]\nType=simple\nUser=shanta\nGroup=shanta\nWorkingDirectory=/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv\nEnvironment=PERL5LIB=/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/local/lib/perl5\nEnvironment=PATH=/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/local/bin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/bin\nEnvironment=CATALYST_DEBUG=1\nExecStart=/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/script/comserv_server.pl -r -p 3000\nRestart=always\nRestartSec=10\nStandardOutput=journal\nStandardError=journal\n\n[Install]\nWantedBy=multi-user.target","language":"plain text"},"codebaseEnabled":true},"createdAt":1750594548564,"isInternal":false,"rawContent":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"That may brack the real starman started at at boot"}]}]}},{"id":"4120f248-5214-4558-83e3-0978f63d907d","role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"You're absolutely right! The issue is happening on your production server at `/opt/comserv/Comserv/`, not on this development machine at `/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/`.\n\nThe problem is on your production server where:\n- Starman is looking for `/opt/comserv/Comserv/app.psgi` \n- But the actual file is `/opt/comserv/Comserv/comserv.psgi`\n\n## Solutions for your production server:\n\n### Option 1: Create app.psgi on the production server\nSSH into your production server and create the missing file:\n\n```bash\n# On your production server (ubuntu@comservproduction1)\ncd /opt/comserv/Comserv/\ncp comserv.psgi app.psgi\n```\n\n### Option 2: Create a symbolic link on the production server\n```bash\n# On your production server\ncd /opt/comserv/Comserv/\nln -s comserv.psgi app.psgi\n```\n\n### Option 3: Find and update the systemd service or startup script\nThe production server likely has a systemd service file (probably in `/etc/systemd/system/` or similar) that's configured to look for `app.psgi`. You could update that service file to point to `comserv.psgi` instead.\n\n**The safest approach is Option 1** - just copy `comserv.psgi` to `app.psgi` on your production server. This won't break any existing startup configurations and will resolve the immediate issue.\n\nWould you like me to help you identify what might be causing the system to expect `app.psgi` specifically, or do you want to go with the simple copy solution on the production server?"}],"context":{"author":"Coding Agent","operationId":"3684eda7-1c1e-4405-a285-3aa88a9b9d1a"},"createdAt":1750594643591,"isInternal":false},{"id":"cd5e5480-f7dc-4da8-a078-b2c6a8ca92f2","role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"journalctl -u starman -f --since \"5 minutes ago\""},{"type":"text","text":"What would be the code to restart starman"}],"context":{"codebaseEnabled":true},"createdAt":1750595115613,"isInternal":false,"rawContent":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"journalctl -u starman -f --since \"5 minutes ago\""}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What would be the code to restart starman"}]}]}},{"id":"9f15f652-90be-4376-87a4-3ca905bf5056","role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"To restart the Starman service, use:\n\n```bash\nsudo systemctl restart starman\n```\n\nHere are the common systemctl commands for managing the Starman service:\n\n```bash\n# Restart the service\nsudo systemctl restart starman\n\n# Stop the service\nsudo systemctl stop starman\n\n# Start the service\nsudo systemctl start starman\n\n# Check status\nsudo systemctl status starman\n\n# Enable auto-start at boot\nsudo systemctl enable starman\n\n# Disable auto-start at boot\nsudo systemctl disable starman\n\n# Reload systemd configuration (if you modify the service file)\nsudo systemctl daemon-reload\n```\n\nSince you're already monitoring the logs with `journalctl -u starman -f --since \"5 minutes ago\"`, after you create the missing `app.psgi` file on your production server, you can restart Starman and watch the logs in real-time to see if the issue is resolved.\n\nThe sequence would be:\n1. Create the missing file: `cp /opt/comserv/Comserv/comserv.psgi /opt/comserv/Comserv/app.psgi`\n2. Restart the service: `sudo systemctl restart starman`\n3. Monitor the logs: `journalctl -u starman -f` (continue watching your existing log command)"}],"context":{"author":"Coding Agent","operationId":"4a43e5fe-d9a8-421f-8acb-56d964947e74"},"createdAt":1750595118309,"isInternal":false},{"id":"5013d346-3825-4137-b6ad-7e8203b83e2c","role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Were is the location of the demon file."}],"context":{"codebaseEnabled":true},"createdAt":1750595987964,"isInternal":false,"rawContent":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Were is the location of the demon file."}]}]}},{"id":"92e9f587-c261-4e0b-a5a8-c9cac82d7ba5","role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The systemd service file (daemon file) for Starman is typically located in one of these directories:\n\n## Most Common Locations:\n\n1. **System-wide services:**\n ```bash\n /etc/systemd/system/starman.service\n ```\n\n2. **User services:**\n ```bash\n /lib/systemd/system/starman.service\n ```\n\n3. **Package-installed services:**\n ```bash\n /usr/lib/systemd/system/starman.service\n ```\n\n## To find the exact location, run these commands on your production server:\n\n```bash\n# Find the service file\nsudo find /etc/systemd /lib/systemd /usr/lib/systemd -name \"starman.service\" 2>/dev/null\n\n# Or use systemctl to show the service file location\nsystemctl status starman\n\n# Or get detailed info about the service\nsystemctl show starman | grep FragmentPath\n```\n\n## To view the service file content:\n```bash\n# Once you find the location, view it with:\nsudo cat /etc/systemd/system/starman.service\n# or wherever the file is located\n```\n\nThe service file will contain the `ExecStart` line that shows exactly what command is being run and which PSGI file it's trying to load. This will confirm whether it's hardcoded to look for `app.psgi` or if it can be easily changed to `comserv.psgi`.\n\nRun these commands on your production server to locate and examine the daemon file."}],"context":{"author":"Coding Agent","operationId":"5eea7306-b31e-4e3e-9177-b079971b36e1"},"createdAt":1750595990348,"isInternal":false},{"id":"74683cec-3974-4bb9-abaa-ce49a0580084","role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We always seem to have a problem changeing branches. we are in the wrong branch and need to change How do we stash the changes."}],"context":{"codebaseEnabled":true},"createdAt":1750596517896,"isInternal":false,"rawContent":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We always seem to have a problem changeing branches. we are in the wrong branch and need to change How do we stash the changes."}]}]}},{"id":"e8db43ab-6535-4e24-85b9-ee0ba7e7e0e1","role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"To stash your changes and switch branches safely, here's the process:\n\n## 1. Check current status and branch:\n```bash\ngit status\ngit branch\n```\n\n## 2. Stash your current changes:\n```bash\n# Stash all changes with a descriptive message\ngit stash push -m \"Work in progress before branch switch\"\n\n# Or just use the simple stash command\ngit stash\n```\n\n## 3. Switch to the correct branch:\n```bash\n# Switch to existing branch\ngit checkout branch-name\n\n# Or create and switch to new branch\ngit checkout -b new-branch-name\n```\n\n## 4. If you want to apply the stashed changes to the new branch:\n```bash\n# List your stashes\ngit stash list\n\n# Apply the most recent stash\ngit stash pop\n\n# Or apply a specific stash (if you have multiple)\ngit stash apply stash@{0}\n```\n\n## Useful stash commands:\n```bash\n# See what's in your stash\ngit stash show\n\n# See detailed diff of stashed changes\ngit stash show -p\n\n# Drop a stash (delete it)\ngit stash drop\n\n# Clear all stashes\ngit stash clear\n```\n\n## Alternative - if you want to commit instead of stash:\n```bash\n# Make a temporary commit\ngit add .\ngit commit -m \"WIP: temporary commit before branch switch\"\n\n# Then switch branches\ngit checkout correct-branch-name\n\n# Later, you can reset the commit if needed\ngit reset HEAD~1\n```\n\nWhat branch do you need to switch to?"}],"context":{"author":"Coding Now let me create a simple management script to help you control the development Starman service:"},{"type":"toolCall","toolCallId":"toolu_019QfrruVn7LMGBfwKBcCHWh","statusText":"Change generated","status":"SUCCESS","context":{"files":[{"path":"manage-dev-server.sh","fsPath":"/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/manage-dev-server.sh"}]},"isHidden":false},{"type":"codeHunk","lineBasedDiff":"--- manage-dev-server.sh\n+++ manage-dev-server.sh\n@@ -0,0 +1,52 @@\n+#!/bin/bash\n+\n+# Comserv Development Server Management Script\n+\n+case \"$1\" in\n+ start)\n+ echo \"Starting Comserv development server...\"\n+ sudo systemctl start comserv-dev.service\n+ echo \"Development server started on port 3000\"\n+ ;;\n+ stop)\n+ echo \"Stopping Comserv development server...\"\n+ sudo systemctl stop comserv-dev.service\n+ echo \"Development server stopped\"\n+ ;;\n+ restart)\n+ echo \"Restarting Comserv development server...\"\n+ sudo systemctl restart comserv-dev.service\n+ echo \"Development server restarted\"\n+ ;;\n+ status)\n+ sudo systemctl status comserv-dev.service\n+ ;;\n+ logs)\n+ sudo journalctl -u comserv-dev.service -f\n+ ;;\n+ enable)\n+ echo \"Enabling Comserv development server to start on boot...\"\n+ sudo systemctl enable comserv-dev.service\n+ echo \"Development server enabled for boot startup\"\n+ ;;\n+ disable)\n+ echo \"Disabling Comserv development server from starting on boot...\"\n+ sudo systemctl disable comserv-dev.service\n+ echo \"Development server disabled from boot startup\"\n+ ;;\n+ *)\n+ echo \"Usage: $0 {start|stop|restart|status|logs|enable|disable}\"\n+ echo \"\"\n+ echo \"Commands:\"\n+ echo \" start - Now you have both servers set up and running:\n\n## **Both Servers Now Running**\n\n**Current Status:**\n- **Development Server:** Port 3000 (Catalyst development server - currently running)\n- **Production Server:** Port 5000 (Starman with 4 workers - now running)\n\n**Services Configured:**\n- `comserv-dev.service` - Development Starman on port 3000\n- `comserv-prod.service` - Production Starman on port 5000\n\n**Management Commands:**\n```bash\n# Development server (port 3000)\n./manage-dev-server.sh dev start\n./manage-dev-server.sh dev stop\n./manage-dev-server.sh dev restart\n./manage-dev-server.sh dev status\n./manage-dev-server.sh dev logs\n\n# Production server (port 5000)\n./manage-dev-server.sh prod start\n./manage-dev-server.sh prod stop\n./manage-dev-server.sh prod restart\n./manage-dev-server.sh prod status\n./manage-dev-server.sh prod logs\n```\n\n**Note:** You currently have the old Catalyst development server running on port 3000. If you want to switch to Starman on port 3000, you should:\n\n1. Stop the old development server: `kill 24691`\n2. Initialize the logging system\n BEGIN {\n Comserv::Util::Logging->init();\n }\n\n use Catalyst::Runtime 5.80;\n use Catalyst qw/\n ConfigLoader\n Static::Simple\n StackTrace\n Session\n Session::Store::File\n Session::State::Cookie\n Authentication\n Authorization::Roles\n Log::Dispatch\n Authorization::ACL\n /;\n\nextends 'Catalyst';\n\nour $VERSION = '0.01';\n\n__PACKAGE__->log(Catalyst::Log->new(output => sub {\n my ($self, $level, $message) = @_;\n $level = 'debug' unless defined $level;\n $message = '' unless defined $message;\n $self->dispatchers->[0]->log(level => $level, message => $message);\n}));\n\n__PACKAGE__->config(\n name => 'Comserv',\n disable_component_resolution_regex_fallback => 1,\n enable_catalyst_header => $ENV{CATALYST_HEADER} // 1,\n encoding => 'UTF-8',\n debug => $ENV{CATALYST_DEBUG} // 0,\n default_view => 'TT',\n use_request_uri_for_path => 1, # Use the request URI for path matching\n use_hash_path_suffix => 1, # Use hash path suffix for better URL handling\n 'Plugin::Log::Dispatch' => {\n dispatchers => [\n {\n class => 'Log::Dispatch::File',\n min_level => 'debug',\n filename => 'logs/application.log',\n mode => 'append',\n newline => 1,\n },\n ],\n },\n);\n __PACKAGE__->config(\n name => 'Comserv',\n disable_component_resolution_regex_fallback => 1,\n enable_catalyst_header => $ENV{CATALYST_HEADER} // 1,\n encoding => 'UTF-8',\n debug => $ENV{CATALYST_DEBUG} // 0,\n default_view => 'TT',\n # Configure URI generation to not include port\n using_frontend_proxy => 1,\n ignore_frontend_proxy_port => 1,\n 'Plugin::Authentication' => {\n default_realm => 'members',\n realms => {\n members => {\n credential => {\n class => 'Password',\n password_field => 'password',\n password_type => 'hashed',\n },\n store => {\n class => 'DBIx::Class',\n user_model => 'DB::User',\n role_relation => 'roles',\n role_field => 'role',\n },\n },\n },\n },\n 'Plugin::Session' => {\n storage => '/tmp/session_data',\n expires => 3600,\n },\n 'Model::ThemeConfig' => {\n # Theme configuration model\n },\n 'Model::Proxmox' => {\n # Proxmox VE API configuration\n proxmox_host => '172.30.236.89',\n api_url_base => 'https://172.30.236.89:8006/api2/json',\n node => 'pve', # Default Proxmox node name\n image_url_base => 'http://172.30.167.222/kvm-images', # URL for VM templates\n username => 'root', # Proxmox username\n password => 'password', # Proxmox password - CHANGE THIS TO YOUR ACTUAL PASSWORD\n realm => 'pam', # Proxmox authentication realm\n },\n 'Model::NPM' => {\n # NPM configuration is loaded dynamically from environment-specific config files\n # See Comserv::Controller::NPM for implementation details\n },\n );\n\nsub psgi_app {\n my $self = shift;\n\n my $app = $self->SUPER::psgi_app(@_);\n\n return sub {\n my $env = shift;\n\n $self->config->{enable_catalyst_header} = $ENV{CATALYST_HEADER} // 1;\n $self->config->{debug} = $ENV{CATALYST_DEBUG} // 0;\n\n return $app->($env);\n };\n }\n\n\n # Auto-fix for missing modules - attempt to load modules with fallbacks\n # This ensures the application works even if modules are missing\n \n # First, try to load email modules\n my $email_modules_loaded = 1;\n eval {\n require Comserv::View::Email;\n require Comserv::View::Email::Template;\n };\n if ($@) {\n warn \"Warning: Could not load Comserv email view modules: $@\\n\";\n warn \"Email functionality may not work correctly.\\n\";\n $email_modules_loaded = 0;\n \n # Try to auto-install the modules if we're in development mode\n if ($ENV{CATALYST_DEBUG}) {\n warn \"Attempting to auto-install email modules...\\n\";\n eval {\n require App::cpanminus;\n my $local_lib = __PACKAGE__->path_to('local');\n system(\"cpanm --local-lib=$local_lib --notest Catalyst::View::Email Catalyst::View::Email::Template\");\n \n # Try to auto-install the modules if we're in development mode\n if ($ENV{CATALYST_DEBUG}) {\n warn \"Attempting to auto-install email modules...\\n\";\n eval {\n require App::cpanminus;\n my $local_lib = __PACKAGE__->path_to('local');\n system(\"cpanm --local-lib=$local_lib --notest Catalyst::View::Email Catalyst::View::Email::Template\");\n \n # The issue is on your **server** where the pull isn't working, not on your local development machine. \n\nSince I can only run commands locally in your development environment, I can't directly fix the server-side Git issue. However, I can help you with the commands you'll need to run **on your server** to force the pull.\n\nHere are the commands you should try **on your server**:\n\n## Option 1: Force pull with reset\n```bash\ngit fetch origin\ngit reset --hard origin/master\n```\n\n## Option 2: Force pull by discarding local changes\n```bash\ngit fetch origin\ngit checkout master\ngit reset --hard origin/master\n```\n\n## Option 3: If the above don't work, try a clean pull\n```bash\ngit fetch --all\ngit reset --hard origin/master\ngit clean -fd\n```\n\n## Option 4: Nuclear option - re-clone if nothing else works\n```bash\n# Backup any local changes first\nmv your-repo-directory your-repo-directory-backup\ngit clone https://github.com/shantamcbain/comserv2.git your-repo-directory\n```\n\n## Diagnostic commands to run on the server first:\n```bash\ngit status\ngit remote -v\ngit log --oneline -3\ngit log --oneline origin/master -3\n```\n\nThe most likely issue is that your server's Git thinks it's up to date when it's not, or there might be some local changes or conflicts preventing the pull. Use the request URI for path matching\n use_hash_path_suffix => 1, # Use hash path suffix for better URL handling\n 'Plugin::Log::Dispatch' => {\n dispatchers => [\n {\n class => 'Log::Dispatch::File',\n min_level => 'debug',\n filename => 'logs/application.log',\n mode => 'append',\n newline => 1,\n },\n ],\n },\n);\n __PACKAGE__->config(\n name => 'Comserv',\n disable_component_resolution_regex_fallback => 1,\n enable_catalyst_header => $ENV{CATALYST_HEADER} // 1,\n encoding => 'UTF-8',\n debug => $ENV{CATALYST_DEBUG} // 0,\n default_view => 'TT',\n # Configure URI generation to not include port\n using_frontend_proxy => 1,\n ignore_frontend_proxy_port => 1,\n 'Plugin::Authentication' => {\n default_realm => 'members',\n realms => {\n members => {\n credential => {\n class => 'Password',\n password_field => 'password',\n password_type => 'hashed',\n },\n store => {\n class => 'DBIx::Class',\n user_model => 'DB::User',\n role_relation => 'roles',\n role_field => 'role',\n },\n },\n },\n },\n 'Plugin::Session' => {\n storage => '/tmp/session_data',\n expires => 3600,\n },\n 'Model::ThemeConfig' => {\n # Proxmox authentication realm\n },\n 'Model::NPM' => {\n # NPM configuration is loaded dynamically from environment-specific config files\n # See Comserv::Controller::NPM for implementation details\n },\n );\n\nsub psgi_app {\n my $self = shift;\n\n my $app = $self->SUPER::psgi_app(@_);\n\n return sub {\n my $env = shift;\n\n $self->config->{enable_catalyst_header} = $ENV{CATALYST_HEADER} // 1;\n $self->config->{debug} = $ENV{CATALYST_DEBUG} // 0;\n\n return $app->($env);\n };\n }\n\n\n # Auto-fix for missing modules - attempt to load modules with fallbacks\n # This ensures the application works even if modules are missing\n \n # First, try to load email modules\n my $email_modules_loaded = 1;\n eval {\n require Comserv::View::Email;\n require Comserv::View::Email::Template;\n };\n if ($@) {\n warn \"Warning: Could not load Comserv email view modules: $@\\n\";\n warn \"Email functionality may not work correctly.\\n\";\n $email_modules_loaded = 0;\n \n # Try to auto-install the modules if we're in development mode\n if ($ENV{CATALYST_DEBUG}) {\n warn \"Attempting to auto-install email modules...\\n\";\n eval {\n require App::cpanminus;\n my $local_lib = __PACKAGE__->path_to('local');\n system(\"cpanm --local-lib=$local_lib --notest Catalyst::View::Email Catalyst::View::Email::Template\");\n \n # Try loading again after installation\n require Comserv::View::Email;\n require Comserv::View::Email::Template;\n $email_modules_loaded = 1;\n };\n if ($@) {\n warn \"Auto-installation failed: $@\\n\";\n warn \"Email functionality will be limited.\\n\";\n }\n }\n }\n \n # Check for session store modules\n my $session_modules_loaded = 1;\n eval {\n require Catalyst::Plugin::Session::Store::File;\n };\n if ($@) {\n warn \"Warning: Could not load session store modules: $@\\n\";\n warn \"Using fallback session storage mechanism.\\n\";\n $session_modules_loaded = 0;\n \n # Configure to use Cookie store as fallback\n __PACKAGE__->config(\n 'Plugin::Session' => {\n storage => 'Cookie',\n }\n );\n }\n\n \n # Add authentication helper methods to the context\n sub user_exists {\n my $c = shift;\n return ($c->session->{username} && $c->session->{user_id}) ? 1 : 0;\n }\n\n sub check_user_roles {\n my ($c, $role) = @_;\n \n # First check if the user exists\n return 0 unless $c->user_exists;\n \n # Get roles from session\n my $roles = $c->session->{roles};\n \n # Check if the user has the admin role in the session\n if ($role eq 'admin') {\n # For admin role, check if user is in the admin group or has admin privileges\n if ($c->session->{is_admin}) {\n return 1;\n }\n \n # Check roles array\n if (ref($roles) eq 'ARRAY') {\n foreach my $user_role (@$roles) {\n if (lc($user_role) eq 'admin') {\n return 1;\n }\n }\n }\n # Check roles string\n elsif (defined $roles && !ref($roles)) {\n if ($roles =~ /\\badmin\\b/i) {\n return 1;\n }\n }\n \n # Check user_groups\n my $user_groups = $c->session->{user_groups};\n if (ref($user_groups) eq 'ARRAY') {\n foreach my $group (@$user_groups) {\n if (lc($group) eq 'admin') {\n return 1;\n }\n }\n }\n elsif (defined $user_groups && !ref($user_groups)) {\n if ($user_groups =~ /\\badmin\\b/i) {\n return 1;\n }\n }\n }\n \n # For other roles, check if the role is in the user's roles\n if (ref($roles) eq 'ARRAY') {\n foreach my $user_role (@$roles) {\n if (lc($user_role) eq lc($role)) {\n return 1;\n }\n }\n }\n elsif (defined $roles && !ref($roles)) {\n if ($roles =~ /\\b$role\\b/i) {\n return 1;\n }\n }\n \n # Role not found\n return 0;\n }\n\n __PACKAGE__->setup();\n\n 1;","language":"perl5"},"codebaseEnabled":true},"createdAt":1750601744326,"isInternal":false,"rawContent":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Option one worked thanks"}]}]}},{"id":"0f467fe4-8a30-4220-8380-dca240d5e4dc","role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Excellent! Comserv/script/migrate_forager_to_ency_pages.pl\n+++ Comserv/script/migrate_forager_to_ency_pages.pl\n@@ -0,0 +1,207 @@\n+#!/usr/bin/perl\n+use strict;\n+use warnings;\n+use lib '../lib';\n+use Comserv::Model::Schema::Forager;\n+use Comserv::Model::Schema::Ency;\n+use JSON;\n+use Data::Dumper;\n+use DateTime;\n+\n+# Migration script: Forager Page -> Ency Page + Content\n+# This script migrates page data from the old Forager schema to the new Ency schema\n+\n+print \"=== Forager to Ency Page Migration ===\\n\";\n+\n+# Database connections\n+my $forager_schema = Comserv::Model::Schema::Forager->connect(\n+ 'dbi:mysql:dbname=forager', 'shanta_forager', 'UA=nPF8*m+T#'\n+);\n+\n+my $ency_schema = Comserv::Model::Schema::Ency->connect(\n+ 'dbi:mysql:dbname=ency', 'shanta_forager', 'UA=nPF8*m+T#'\n+);\n+\n+# Migration statistics\n+my $stats = {\n+ total_pages => 0,\n+ migrated_pages => 0,\n+ migrated_content => 0,\n+ errors => 0,\n+ warnings => 0\n+};\n+\n+# Helper function to map user names to user IDs\n+sub get_user_id_by_username {\n+ my ($username) = @_;\n+ \n+ # Try to find user in Ency schema\n+ my $user = $ency_schema->resultset('User::User')->find({ username => $username });\n+ return $user ? $user->id : undef;\n+}\n+\n+# Helper function to consolidate social media fields\n+sub build_social_media_json {\n+ my ($newsletter, $linkedin, $mailchimp) = @_;\n+ \n+ my $social_media = {};\n+ $social_media->{newsletter} = $newsletter if $newsletter;\n+ $social_media->{linkedin} = $linkedin if $linkedin;\n+ $social_media->{mailchimp} = $mailchimp if $mailchimp;\n+ \n+ return keys %$social_media ? encode_json($social_media) : undef;\n+}\n+\n+# Main migration function\n+sub migrate_pages {\n+ print \"Starting page migration...\\n\";\n+ \n+ # Get all pages from Forager\n+ my $forager_pages = $forager_schema->resultset('Page')->search({});\n+ $stats->{total_pages} = $forager_pages->count;\n+ \n+ print \"Found \" . $stats->{total_pages} . \" pages to migrate\\n\";\n+ \n+ # Start transaction\n+ $ency_schema->txn_do(sub {\n+ while (my $old_page = $forager_pages->next) {\n+ eval {\n+ # Create content record first\n+ my $content_data = {\n+ title => $old_page->app_title || 'Untitled',\n+ body => $old_page->body || '',\n+ meta_description => $old_page->description,\n+ meta_keywords => $old_page->keywords,\n+ created_at => $old_page->last_mod_date || DateTime->now,\n+ updated_at => $old_page->lastupdate || $old_page->last_mod_date || DateTime->now,\n+ created_by => 1, # Default admin user - adjust as needed\n+ updated_by => 1, # Default admin user - adjust as needed\n+ status => 'published' # Assume existing pages are published\n+ };\n+ \n+ # Try to map the user who last modified\n+ if ($old_page->last_mod_by) {\n+ my $user_id = get_user_id_by_username($old_page->last_mod_by);\n+ if ($user_id) {\n+ $content_data->{updated_by} = $user_id;\n+ $content_data->{created_by} = $user_id;\n+ } else {\n+ print \"Warning: Could not find user '\" . $old_page->last_mod_by . \"' for page \" . $old_page->page_code . \"\\n\";\n+ $stats->{warnings}++;\n+ }\n+ }\n+ \n+ my $content = $ency_schema->resultset('Content')->create($content_data);\n+ $stats->{migrated_content}++;\n+ \n+ # Create page record\n+ my $page_data = {\n+ title => $old_page->app_title || 'Untitled',\n+ content_id => $content->id,\n+ page_code => $old_page->page_code,\n+ status => $old_page->status || 'active',\n+ share => $old_page->share || 'public',\n+ link_order => $old_page->link_order || 0,\n+ news => $old_page->news || 0,\n+ last_modified_at => $old_page->last_mod_date,\n+ created_at => $old_page->last_mod_date || DateTime->now\n+ };\n+ \n+ # Map user for last_modified_by\n+ if ($old_page->last_mod_by) {\n+ my $user_id = get_user_id_by_username($old_page->last_mod_by);\n+ $page_data->{last_modified_by} = $user_id if $user_id;\n+ }\n+ \n+ # Build social media JSON\n+ my $social_media = build_social_media_json(\n+ $old_page->newsletter,\n+ $old_page->linkedin, \n+ $old_page->mailchimp\n+ );\n+ $page_data->{social_media} = $social_media if $social_media;\n+ \n+ my $new_page = $ency_schema->resultset('Page')->create($page_data);\n+ $stats->{migrated_pages}++;\n+ \n+ print \"Migrated page: \" . $old_page->page_code . \" -> ID: \" . $new_page->id . \"\\n\";\n+ \n+ } catch {\n+ print \"Error migrating page \" . $old_page->page_code . \": $_\\n\";\n+ $stats->{errors}++;\n+ };\n+ }\n+ });\n+}\n+\n+# Data validation function\n+sub validate_migration {\n+ print \"\\n=== Validation ===\\n\";\n+ \n+ my $ency_pages = $ency_schema->resultset('Page')->count;\n+ my $ency_content = $ency_schema->resultset('Content')->count;\n+ \n+ print \"Pages in Ency schema: $ency_pages\\n\";\n+ print \"Content records in Ency schema: $ency_content\\n\";\n+ \n+ # Check for missing relationships\n+ my $pages_without_content = $ency_schema->resultset('Page')->search({\n+ content_id => undef\n+ })->count;\n+ \n+ if ($pages_without_content > 0) {\n+ print \"Warning: $pages_without_content pages without content!\\n\";\n+ $stats->{warnings} += $pages_without_content;\n+ }\n+ \n+ # Check for orphaned content\n+ my $orphaned_content = $ency_schema->resultset('Content')->search({\n+ 'pages.content_id' => undef\n+ }, {\n+ join => 'pages'\n+ })->count;\n+ \n+ if ($orphaned_content > 0) {\n+ print \"Warning: $orphaned_content orphaned content records!\\n\";\n+ $stats->{warnings} += $orphaned_content;\n+ }\n+}\n+\n+# Generate migration report\n+sub generate_report {\n+ print \"\\n=== Migration Report ===\\n\";\n+ print \"Total pages found: \" . $stats->{total_pages} . \"\\n\";\n+ print \"Pages migrated: \" . $stats->{migrated_pages} . \"\\n\";\n+ print \"Content records created: \" . $stats->{migrated_content} . \"\\n\";\n+ print \"Errors: \" . $stats->{errors} . \"\\n\";\n+ print \"Warnings: \" . $stats->{warnings} . \"\\n\";\n+ \n+ my $success_rate = $stats->{total_pages} > 0 ? \n+ sprintf(\"%.2f\", ($stats->{migrated_pages} / $stats->{total_pages}) * 100) : 0;\n+ print \"Success rate: ${success_rate}%\\n\";\n+ \n+ # Save report to file\n+ my $report_file = \"migration_report_\" . DateTime->now->strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S') . \".json\";\n+ open my $fh, '>', $report_file or die \"Cannot open $report_file: $!\";\n+ print $fh encode_json({\n+ timestamp => DateTime->now->iso8601,\n+ statistics => $stats,\n+ success_rate => $success_rate\n+ });\n+ close $fh;\n+ \n+ print \"Detailed report saved to: $report_file\\n\";\n+}\n+\n+# Main execution\n+eval {\n+ migrate_pages();\n+ validate_migration();\n+ generate_report();\n+ \n+ print \"\\n=== Migration Complete ===\\n\";\n+ \n+} catch {\n+ print \"Fatal error during migration: $_\\n\";\n+ exit 1;\n+};","refToolCallId":"toolu_014DKRZ2A8CC4fBG22apP5qL"},{"type":"text","text":"### **Phase 4: Create Rollback Script**"},{"type":"toolCall","toolCallId":"toolu_01F3Gnibe5SwCx2vs23Q8HCG","statusText":"Change generated","status":"SUCCESS","context":{"files":[{"path":"Comserv/script/rollback_page_migration.pl","fsPath":"/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/script/rollback_page_migration.pl"}]},"isHidden":false},{"type":"codeHunk","lineBasedDiff":"--- Comserv/script/rollback_page_migration.pl\n+++ Comserv/script/rollback_page_migration.pl\n@@ -0,0 +1,95 @@\n+#!/usr/bin/perl\n+use strict;\n+use warnings;\n+use lib '../lib';\n+use Comserv::Model::Schema::Ency;\n+use JSON;\n+use DateTime;\n+\n+# Rollback script for page migration\n+# This script removes migrated pages and content from Ency schema\n+\n+print \"=== Page Migration Rollback ===\\n\";\n+print \"WARNING: This will delete all pages and content from the Ency schema!\\n\";\n+print \"Are you sure you want to continue? (yes/no): \";\n+\n+my $confirmation = <STDIN>;\n+chomp $confirmation;\n+\n+unless ($confirmation eq 'yes') {\n+ print \"Rollback cancelled.\\n\";\n+ exit 0;\n+}\n+\n+# Database connection\n+my $ency_schema = Comserv::Model::Schema::Ency->connect(\n+ 'dbi:mysql:dbname=ency', 'shanta_forager', 'UA=nPF8*m+T#'\n+);\n+\n+# Rollback statistics\n+my $stats = {\n+ pages_deleted => 0,\n+ content_deleted => 0,\n+ errors => 0\n+};\n+\n+# Main rollback function\n+sub rollback_migration {\n+ print \"Starting rollback...\\n\";\n+ \n+ # Start transaction\n+ $ency_schema->txn_do(sub {\n+ # Delete pages first (due to foreign key constraints)\n+ eval {\n+ my $pages = $ency_schema->resultset('Page')->search({});\n+ $stats->{pages_deleted} = $pages->count;\n+ $pages->delete_all;\n+ print \"Deleted \" . $stats->{pages_deleted} . \" pages\\n\";\n+ } catch {\n+ print \"Error deleting pages: $_\\n\";\n+ $stats->{errors}++;\n+ };\n+ \n+ # Delete content\n+ eval {\n+ my $content = $ency_schema->resultset('Content')->search({});\n+ $stats->{content_deleted} = $content->count;\n+ $content->delete_all;\n+ print \"Deleted \" . $stats->{content_deleted} . \" content records\\n\";\n+ } catch {\n+ print \"Error deleting content: $_\\n\";\n+ $stats->{errors}++;\n+ };\n+ });\n+}\n+\n+# Generate rollback report\n+sub generate_rollback_report {\n+ print \"\\n=== Rollback Report ===\\n\";\n+ print \"Pages deleted: \" . $stats->{pages_deleted} . \"\\n\";\n+ print \"Content deleted: \" . $stats->{content_deleted} . \"\\n\";\n+ print \"Errors: \" . $stats->{errors} . \"\\n\";\n+ \n+ # Save report to file\n+ my $report_file = \"rollback_report_\" . DateTime->now->strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S') . \".json\";\n+ open my $fh, '>', $report_file or die \"Cannot open $report_file: $!\";\n+ print $fh encode_json({\n+ timestamp => DateTime->now->iso8601,\n+ statistics => $stats\n+ });\n+ close $fh;\n+ \n+ print \"Rollback report saved to: $report_file\\n\";\n+}\n+\n+# Main execution\n+eval {\n+ rollback_migration();\n+ generate_rollback_report();\n+ \n+ print \"\\n=== Rollback Complete ===\\n\";\n+ \n+} catch {\n+ print \"Fatal error during rollback: $_\\n\";\n+ exit Comserv/script/validate_pre_migration.pl\n+++ Comserv/script/validate_pre_migration.pl\n@@ -0,0 +1,219 @@\n+#!/usr/bin/perl\n+use strict;\n+use warnings;\n+use lib '../lib';\n+use Comserv::Model::Schema::Forager;\n+use Comserv::Model::Schema::Ency;\n+use JSON;\n+use Data::Dumper;\n+\n+# Pre-migration validation script\n+# This script analyzes the Forager data and identifies potential migration issues\n+\n+print \"=== Pre-Migration Validation ===\\n\";\n+\n+# Database connections\n+my $forager_schema = Comserv::Model::Schema::Forager->connect(\n+ 'dbi:mysql:dbname=forager', 'shanta_forager', 'UA=nPF8*m+T#'\n+);\n+\n+my $ency_schema = Comserv::Model::Schema::Ency->connect(\n+ 'dbi:mysql:dbname=ency', 'shanta_forager', 'UA=nPF8*m+T#'\n+);\n+\n+# Validation results\n+my $validation = {\n+ total_pages => 0,\n+ issues => [],\n+ warnings => [],\n+ recommendations => []\n+};\n+\n+# Check Forager data\n+sub validate_forager_data {\n+ print \"Validating Forager data...\\n\";\n+ \n+ my $pages = $forager_schema->resultset('Page')->search({});\n+ $validation->{total_pages} = $pages->count;\n+ \n+ print \"Found \" . $validation->{total_pages} . \" pages in Forager schema\\n\";\n+ \n+ # Check for required fields\n+ my $missing_page_codes = $pages->search({ page_code => [undef, ''] })->count;\n+ if ($missing_page_codes > 0) {\n+ push @{$validation->{issues}}, \"Found $missing_page_codes pages with missing page_code\";\n+ }\n+ \n+ my $missing_titles = $pages->search({ app_title => [undef, ''] })->count;\n+ if ($missing_titles > 0) {\n+ push @{$validation->{warnings}}, \"Found $missing_titles pages with missing app_title\";\n+ }\n+ \n+ # Check for duplicate page codes\n+ my $duplicate_codes = $forager_schema->storage->dbh->selectall_arrayref(\n+ \"SELECT page_code, COUNT(*) as count FROM page GROUP BY page_code HAVING COUNT(*) > 1\"\n+ );\n+ \n+ if (@$duplicate_codes) {\n+ push @{$validation->{issues}}, \"Found duplicate page codes: \" . \n+ join(\", \", map { $_->[0] . \" (\" . $_->[1] . \" times)\" } @$duplicate_codes);\n+ }\n+ \n+ # Check user references\n+ my @unique_users = $pages->search({}, {\n+ select => ['last_mod_by'],\n+ distinct => 1\n+ })->get_column('last_mod_by')->all;\n+ \n+ my $unmapped_users = 0;\n+ for my $username (@unique_users) {\n+ next unless $username;\n+ my $user = $ency_schema->resultset('User::User')->find({ username => $username });\n+ unless ($user) {\n+ $unmapped_users++;\n+ }\n+ }\n+ \n+ if ($unmapped_users > 0) {\n+ push @{$validation->{warnings}}, \"Found $unmapped_users unique usernames that don't exist in Ency schema\";\n+ }\n+}\n+\n+# Check Ency schema readiness\n+sub validate_ency_schema {\n+ print \"Validating Ency schema readiness...\\n\";\n+ \n+ # Check if tables exist\n+ eval {\n+ my $pages_count = $ency_schema->resultset('Page')->count;\n+ my $content_count = $ency_schema->resultset('Content')->count;\n+ \n+ if ($pages_count > 0) {\n+ push @{$validation->{warnings}}, \"Ency pages table already contains $pages_count records\";\n+ }\n+ \n+ if ($content_count > 0) {\n+ push @{$validation->{warnings}}, \"Ency content table already contains $content_count records\";\n+ }\n+ \n+ } catch {\n+ push @{$validation->{issues}}, \"Cannot access Ency schema tables: $_\";\n+ };\n+ \n+ # Check for required relationships\n+ eval {\n+ my $users_count = $ency_schema->resultset('User::User')->count;\n+ if ($users_count == 0) {\n+ push @{$validation->{warnings}}, \"No users found in Ency schema - migration will use default user IDs\";\n+ }\n+ } catch {\n+ push @{$validation->{warnings}}, \"Cannot access User table in Ency schema\";\n+ };\n+}\n+\n+# Generate data analysis\n+sub analyze_data_patterns {\n+ print \"Analyzing data patterns...\\n\";\n+ \n+ my $pages = $forager_schema->resultset('Page')->search({});\n+ \n+ # Analyze field usage\n+ my $field_stats = {\n+ newsletter => 0,\n+ linkedin => 0,\n+ mailchimp => 0,\n+ comments => 0,\n+ view_name => 0\n+ };\n+ \n+ while (my $page = $pages->next) {\n+ $field_stats->{newsletter}++ if $page->newsletter;\n+ $field_stats->{linkedin}++ if $page->linkedin;\n+ $field_stats->{mailchimp}++ if $page->mailchimp;\n+ $field_stats->{comments}++ if $page->comments;\n+ $field_stats->{view_name}++ if $page->view_name;\n+ }\n+ \n+ # Report on fields that will be dropped\n+ for my $field (keys %$field_stats) {\n+ if ($field_stats->{$field} > 0) {\n+ push @{$validation->{warnings}}, \n+ \"Field '$field' has data in \" . $field_stats->{$field} . \" records but will be dropped/consolidated\";\n+ }\n+ }\n+ \n+ # Recommendations\n+ if ($field_stats->{newsletter} + $field_stats->{linkedin} + $field_stats->{mailchimp} > 0) {\n+ push @{$validation->{recommendations}}, \n+ \"Social media fields (newsletter, linkedin, mailchimp) will be consolidated into JSON field\";\n+ }\n+ \n+ if ($field_stats->{comments} > 0) {\n+ push @{$validation->{recommendations}}, \n+ \"Comments field data will be lost - consider manual backup if needed\";\n+ }\n+ \n+ if ($field_stats->{view_name} > 0) {\n+ push @{$validation->{recommendations}}, \n+ \"View name field data will be lost - consider manual backup if needed\";\n+ }\n+}\n+\n+# Generate validation report\n+sub generate_validation_report {\n+ print \"\\n=== Validation Report ===\\n\";\n+ \n+ print \"Total pages to migrate: \" . $validation->{total_pages} . \"\\n\";\n+ \n+ if (@{$validation->{issues}}) {\n+ print \"\\nISSUES (must be resolved before migration):\\n\";\n+ for my $issue (@{$validation->{issues}}) {\n+ print \" $issue\\n\";\n+ }\n+ }\n+ \n+ if (@{$validation->{warnings}}) {\n+ print \"\\nWARNINGS (should be reviewed):\\n\";\n+ for my $warning (@{$validation->{warnings}}) {\n+ print \" $warning\\n\";\n+ }\n+ }\n+ \n+ if (@{$validation->{recommendations}}) {\n+ print \"\\nRECOMMENDATIONS:\\n\";\n+ for my $rec (@{$validation->{recommendations}}) {\n+ print \" $rec\\n\";\n+ }\n+ }\n+ \n+ # Save detailed report\n+ my $report_file = \"pre_migration_validation_\" . DateTime->now->strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S') . \".json\";\n+ open my $fh, '>', $report_file or die \"Cannot open $report_file: $!\";\n+ print $fh encode_json($validation);\n+ close $fh;\n+ \n+ print \"\\nDetailed validation report saved to: $report_file\\n\";\n+ \n+ # Migration readiness assessment\n+ if (@{$validation->{issues}}) {\n+ print \"\\n MIGRATION NOT READY - Please resolve issues first\\n\";\n+ return 0;\n+ } else {\n+ print \"\\n MIGRATION READY - You may proceed with migration\\n\";\n+ return 1;\n+ }\n+}\n+\n+# Main execution\n+eval {\n+ validate_forager_data();\n+ validate_ency_schema();\n+ analyze_data_patterns();\n+ my $ready = generate_validation_report();\n+ \n+ exit($ready ? 0 : 1);\n+ \n+} catch {\n+ print \"Fatal error during validation: $_\\n\";\n+ exit 1;\n+};","refToolCallId":"toolu_01MkfycVXXvTivGfQCLWTZAt"},{"type":"text","text":"### **Phase 6: Create SQL Schema Files**\n\nNow let's create the SQL files that will be used to create the actual Comserv/sql/pages_new.sql\n+++ Comserv/sql/pages_new.sql\n@@ -0,0 +1,53 @@\n+-- New pages table for Ency schema\n+-- Migrated from Forager page table with normalized structure\n+\n+CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS pages (\n+ id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,\n+ title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL COMMENT 'Page title (migrated from app_title)',\n+ content_id INT NULL COMMENT 'Foreign key to content table',\n+ page_code VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL COMMENT 'Unique page code identifier',\n+ status VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL COMMENT 'Page status',\n+ share VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL COMMENT 'Page sharing settings',\n+ link_order INT NOT NULL DEFAULT 0 COMMENT 'Order for page links',\n+ news INT NOT NULL DEFAULT 0 COMMENT 'News flag',\n+ last_modified_by INT NULL COMMENT 'User ID who last modified the page',\n+ CURRENT_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'Timestamp when page was created',\n+ \n+ -- Constraints\n+ UNIQUE KEY unique_page_code (page_code),\n+ \n+ -- Indexes\n+ INDEX idx_pages_status (status),\n+ INDEX Comserv/docs/PAGE_MIGRATION_GUIDE.md\n+++ Comserv/docs/PAGE_MIGRATION_GUIDE.md\n@@ -0,0 +1,227 @@\n+# Page Migration Guide: Forager to Ency Schema\n+\n+## Overview\n+\n+This guide outlines the migration process from the old Forager Page model to the new Ency Page + Content model structure. The migration involves data normalization, field consolidation, and relationship restructuring.\n+\n+## Migration Architecture\n+\n+### Old Structure (Forager)\n+- **Table**: `page`\n+- **Model**: `Comserv::Model::Schema::Forager::Result::Page`\n+- **Characteristics**: Monolithic structure with all page data in one table\n+\n+### New Structure (Ency)\n+- **Tables**: `pages` + `content`\n+- **Models**: \n+ - `Comserv::Model::Schema::Ency::Result::Page`\n+ - `Comserv::Model::Schema::Ency::Result::Content`\n+- **Characteristics**: Normalized structure separating page metadata from content\n+\n+## Field Mapping\n+\n+| Forager Field | Ency Destination | Notes |\n+|---------------|------------------|-------|\n+| `record_id` | `pages.id` | Primary key rename |\n+| `page_code` | `pages.page_code` | Direct mapping |\n+| `app_title` | `pages.title` + `content.title` | Used for both |\n+| `body` | `content.body` | Moved to content table |\n+| `description` | `content.meta_description` | Moved to content table |\n+| `keywords` | `content.meta_keywords` | Moved to content table |\n+| `status` | `pages.status` | Direct mapping |\n+| `share` | `pages.share` | Direct mapping |\n+| `link_order` | `pages.link_order` | Direct mapping |\n+| `news` | `pages.news` | Direct mapping |\n+| `last_mod_by` | `pages.last_modified_by` | Requires user lookup |\n+| `last_mod_date` | `pages.last_modified_at` | Direct mapping |\n+| `lastupdate` | `content.updated_at` | Moved to content table |\n+| `newsletter` | `pages.social_media` (JSON) | Consolidated |\n+| `linkedin` | `pages.social_media` (JSON) | Consolidated |\n+| `mailchimp` | `pages.social_media` (JSON) | Consolidated |\n+| `sitename` | **DROPPED** | Will use Site relationships |\n+| `menu` | **DROPPED** | Will use Navigation relationships |\n+| `view_name` | **DROPPED** | No equivalent |\n+| `page_site` | **DROPPED** | Redundant |\n+| `username_of_poster` | **DROPPED** | Use last_modified_by |\n+| `comments` | **DROPPED** | No equivalent |\n+\n+## Migration Process\n+\n+### Phase 1: Pre-Migration Validation\n+```bash\n+cd /home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/script\n+perl validate_pre_migration.pl\n+```\n+\n+This script will:\n+- Analyze Forager data for issues\n+- Check Ency schema readiness\n+- Identify potential problems\n+- Generate validation report\n+\n+### Phase 2: Schema Deployment\n+```bash\n+# Deploy new tables to Ency database\n+mysql -u shanta_forager -p ency < ../sql/content_new.sql\n+mysql -u shanta_forager -p ency < ../sql/pages_new.sql\n+```\n+\n+### Phase 3: Data Migration\n+```bash\n+perl migrate_forager_to_ency_pages.pl\n+```\n+\n+This script will:\n+- Create content records from Forager page data\n+- Create page records with relationships\n+- Map user references where possible\n+- Consolidate social media fields into JSON\n+- Generate migration report\n+\n+### Phase 4: Post-Migration Validation\n+- Verify record counts match\n+- Check relationship integrity\n+- Validate data consistency\n+- Test application functionality\n+\n+### Phase 5: Rollback (if needed)\n+```bash\n+perl rollback_page_migration.pl\n+```\n+\n+## Data Transformations\n+\n+### Social Media Consolidation\n+The following fields are consolidated into a JSON field:\n+```json\n+{\n+ \"newsletter\": \"value_from_newsletter_field\",\n+ \"linkedin\": \"value_from_linkedin_field\", \n+ \"mailchimp\": \"value_from_mailchimp_field\"\n+}\n+```\n+\n+### User Mapping\n+- `last_mod_by` (username) `last_modified_by` (user_id)\n+- Unmapped users default to admin user (ID: 1)\n+- Warnings generated for unmapped users\n+\n+### Content Status Mapping\n+- Existing pages assumed to be \"published\"\n+- New content workflow: draft published archived\n+\n+## File Structure\n+\n+### JSON Schema Files\n+- `Comserv/sql/json/pages_new.json` - New pages table structure\n+- `Comserv/sql/json/content_new.json` - New content table structure\n+\n+### SQL Files\n+- `Comserv/sql/pages_new.sql` - Pages table creation\n+- `Comserv/sql/content_new.sql` - Content table creation\n+\n+### Migration Scripts\n+- `Comserv/script/validate_pre_migration.pl` - Pre-migration validation\n+- `Comserv/script/migrate_forager_to_ency_pages.pl` - Main migration\n+- `Comserv/script/rollback_page_migration.pl` - Rollback utility\n+\n+## Testing Strategy\n+\n+### Pre-Migration Testing\n+1. Run validation script\n+2. Verify database connections\n+3. Check user mappings\n+4. Review data patterns\n+\n+### Post-Migration Testing\n+1. Verify record counts\n+2. Test page loading\n+3. Check content display\n+4. Validate relationships\n+5. Test CRUD operations\n+\n+## Rollback Plan\n+\n+### Automatic Rollback\n+- Use `rollback_page_migration.pl` script\n+- Removes all migrated data from Ency schema\n+- Preserves original Forager data\n+\n+### Manual Rollback\n+1. Drop Ency pages and content tables\n+2. Recreate original table structure\n+3. Restore from backup if needed\n+\n+## Risk Mitigation\n+\n+### Data Loss Prevention\n+- Original Forager data remains untouched\n+- Migration creates new records, doesn't modify existing\n+- Full rollback capability available\n+\n+### Validation Checkpoints\n+- Pre-migration validation prevents issues\n+- Post-migration validation confirms success\n+- Migration tracking table maintains audit trail\n+\n+## Performance Considerations\n+\n+### Migration Performance\n+- Transaction-based migration for consistency\n+- Batch processing for large datasets\n+- Progress reporting during migration\n+\n+### Post-Migration Performance\n+- Proper indexing on new tables\n+- Foreign key constraints for data integrity\n+- Optimized queries for new structure\n+\n+## Troubleshooting\n+\n+### Common Issues\n+1. **User mapping failures**: Check user table in Ency schema\n+2. **Duplicate page codes**: Resolve duplicates in Forager data\n+3. **Missing required fields**: Validate Forager data completeness\n+4. **Foreign key errors**: Ensure related tables exist\n+\n+### Debug Mode\n+Add debug flags to migration scripts for detailed logging:\n+```perl\n+my $debug = 1; # Enable debug mode\n+```\n+\n+## Post-Migration Tasks\n+\n+### Application Updates\n+1. Update controllers to use new models\n+2. Modify templates for new field names\n+3. Update navigation logic\n+4. Test all page-related functionality\n+\n+### Database Maintenance\n+1. Optimize new table indexes\n+2. Update database documentation\n+3. Schedule regular backups\n+4. Monitor performance\n+\n+## Success Criteria\n+\n+### Migration Success\n+- All pages migrated without data loss\n+- Relationships properly established\n+- User mappings completed\n+- Social media data consolidated\n+- Application functionality maintained\n+\n+### Performance Success\n+- Page load times maintained or improved\n+- Database queries optimized\n+- No significant resource usage increase\n+\n+## Support\n+\n+For issues or questions regarding the migration:\n+1. Check validation reports for specific errors\n+2. Review migration logs for detailed information\n+3. Use rollback script if critical issues arise\n+4. migrated pages and content from Ency schema%0A%0Aprint %22=== Page Migration Rollback ===%5Cn%22;%0Aprint %22WARNING: This will delete all pages and content from the Ency schema!%5Cn%22;%0Aprint %22Are you sure you want to continue? (yes/no): %22;%0A%0Amy $confirmation = %3CSTDIN%3E;%0Achomp $confirmation;%0A%0Aunless ($confirmation eq 'yes') %7B%0A print %22Rollback cancelled.%5Cn%22;%0A exit 0;%0A%7D%0A%0A# Database connection%0Amy $ency_schema = Comserv::Model::Schema::Ency-%3Econnect(%0A 'dbi:mysql:dbname=ency', 'shanta_forager', 'UA=nPF8*m+T#'%0A);%0A%0A# Rollback statistics%0Amy $stats = %7B%0A pages_deleted =%3E 0,%0A content_deleted =%3E 0,%0A errors =%3E 0%0A%7D;%0A%0A# Main rollback function%0Asub rollback_migration %7B%0A print %22Starting rollback...%5Cn%22;%0A %0A # Start transaction%0A $ency_schema-%3Etxn_do(sub %7B%0A # Delete pages first (due to foreign key constraints)%0A eval %7B%0A my $pages = $ency_schema-%3Eresultset('Page')-%3Esearch(%7B%7D);%0A $stats-%3E%7Bpages_deleted%7D = $pages-%3Ecount;%0A $pages-%3Edelete_all;%0A print %22Deleted %22 . $stats-%3E%7Bpages_deleted%7D . %22 pages%5Cn%22;%0A %7D catch %7B%0A print %22Error deleting pages: $_%5Cn%22;%0A $stats-%3E%7Berrors%7D++;%0A %7D;%0A %0A # Delete content%0A eval %7B%0A my $content = $ency_schema-%3Eresultset('Content')-%3Esearch(%7B%7D);%0A $stats-%3E%7Bcontent_deleted%7D = $content-%3Ecount;%0A $content-%3Edelete_all;%0A print %22Deleted %22 . $stats-%3E%7Bcontent_deleted%7D . %22 content records%5Cn%22;%0A %7D catch %7B%0A print %22Error deleting content: $_%5Cn%22;%0A $stats-%3E%7Berrors%7D++;%0A %7D;%0A %7D);%0A%7D%0A%0A# Generate rollback report%0Asub generate_rollback_report %7B%0A print %22%5Cn=== Rollback Report ===%5Cn%22;%0A print %22Pages deleted: %22 . $stats-%3E%7Bpages_deleted%7D . %22%5Cn%22;%0A print %22Content deleted: %22 . $stats-%3E%7Bcontent_deleted%7D . %22%5Cn%22;%0A print %22Errors: %22 . $stats-%3E%7Berrors%7D . %22%5Cn%22;%0A %0A # Save report to file%0A my $report_file = %22rollback_report_%22 . DateTime-%3Enow-%3Estrftime('%25Y%25m%25d_%25H%25M%25S') . %22.json%22;%0A open my $fh, '%3E', $report_file or die %22Cannot open $report_file: $!%22;%0A print $fh encode_json(%7B%0A timestamp =%3E DateTime-%3Enow-%3Eiso8601,%0A statistics =%3E $stats%0A %7D);%0A close $fh;%0A %0A print %22Rollback report saved to: $report_file%5Cn%22;%0A%7D%0A%0A# Main execution%0Aeval %7B%0A rollback_migration();%0A generate_rollback_report();%0A %0A print %22%5Cn=== Rollback Complete ===%5Cn%22;%0A %0A%7D catch %7B%0A print %22Fatal error during rollback: $_%5Cn%22;%0A exit 1;%0A%7D;\n","isNew":true,"isApplied":false,"isUnread":true},{"path":"Comserv/script/validate_pre_migration.pl","patch":"@@ -0,0 +1,6939 @@\n+#!/usr/bin/perl%0Ause strict;%0Ause warnings;%0Ause lib '../lib';%0Ause Comserv::Model::Schema::Forager;%0Ause Comserv::Model::Schema::Ency;%0Ause JSON;%0Ause Data::Dumper;%0A%0A# Pre-migration validation script%0A# This script analyzes the Forager data and identifies potential migration issues%0A%0Aprint %22=== Pre-Migration Validation ===%5Cn%22;%0A%0A# Database connections%0Amy $forager_schema = Comserv::Model::Schema::Forager-%3Econnect(%0A 'dbi:mysql:dbname=forager', 'shanta_forager', 'UA=nPF8*m+T#'%0A);%0A%0Amy $ency_schema = Comserv::Model::Schema::Ency-%3Econnect(%0A 'dbi:mysql:dbname=ency', 'shanta_forager', 'UA=nPF8*m+T#'%0A);%0A%0A# Validation results%0Amy $validation = %7B%0A total_pages =%3E 0,%0A issues =%3E %5B%5D,%0A warnings =%3E %5B%5D,%0A recommendations =%3E %5B%5D%0A%7D;%0A%0A# Check Forager data%0Asub validate_forager_data %7B%0A print %22Validating Forager data...%5Cn%22;%0A %0A my $pages = $forager_schema-%3Eresultset('Page')-%3Esearch(%7B%7D);%0A $validation-%3E%7Btotal_pages%7D = $pages-%3Ecount;%0A %0A print %22Found %22 . $validation-%3E%7Btotal_pages%7D . %22 pages in Forager schema%5Cn%22;%0A %0A # Check for required fields%0A my $missing_page_codes = $pages-%3Esearch(%7B page_code =%3E %5Bundef, ''%5D %7D)-%3Ecount;%0A if ($missing_page_codes %3E 0) %7B%0A push @%7B$validation-%3E%7Bissues%7D%7D, %22Found $missing_page_codes pages with missing page_code%22;%0A %7D%0A %0A my $missing_titles = $pages-%3Esearch(%7B app_title =%3E %5Bundef, ''%5D %7D)-%3Ecount;%0A if ($missing_titles %3E 0) %7B%0A push @%7B$validation-%3E%7Bwarnings%7D%7D, %22Found $missing_titles pages with missing app_title%22;%0A %7D%0A %0A # Check for duplicate page codes%0A my $duplicate_codes = $forager_schema-%3Estorage-%3Edbh-%3Eselectall_arrayref(%0A %22SELECT page_code, COUNT(*) as count FROM page GROUP BY page_code HAVING COUNT(*) %3E 1%22%0A );%0A %0A if (@$duplicate_codes) %7B%0A push @%7B$validation-%3E%7Bissues%7D%7D, %22Found duplicate page codes: %22 . %0A join(%22, %22, map %7B $_-%3E%5B0%5D . %22 (%22 . $_-%3E%5B1%5D . %22 times)%22 %7D @$duplicate_codes);%0A %7D%0A %0A # Check user references%0A my @unique_users = $pages-%3Esearch(%7B%7D, %7B%0A select =%3E %5B'last_mod_by'%5D,%0A distinct =%3E 1%0A %7D)-%3Eget_column('last_mod_by')-%3Eall;%0A %0A my $unmapped_users = 0;%0A for my $username (@unique_users) %7B%0A next unless $username;%0A my $user = $ency_schema-%3Eresultset('User::User')-%3Efind(%7B username =%3E $username %7D);%0A unless ($user) %7B%0A $unmapped_users++;%0A %7D%0A %7D%0A %0A if ($unmapped_users %3E 0) %7B%0A push @%7B$validation-%3E%7Bwarnings%7D%7D, %22Found $unmapped_users unique usernames that don't exist in Ency schema%22;%0A %7D%0A%7D%0A%0A# Check Ency schema readiness%0Asub validate_ency_schema %7B%0A print %22Validating Ency schema readiness...%5Cn%22;%0A %0A # Check if tables exist%0A eval %7B%0A my $pages_count = $ency_schema-%3Eresultset('Page')-%3Ecount;%0A my $content_count = $ency_schema-%3Eresultset('Content')-%3Ecount;%0A %0A if ($pages_count %3E 0) %7B%0A push @%7B$validation-%3E%7Bwarnings%7D%7D, %22Ency pages table already contains $pages_count records%22;%0A %7D%0A %0A if ($content_count %3E 0) %7B%0A push @%7B$validation-%3E%7Bwarnings%7D%7D, %22Ency content table already contains $content_count records%22;%0A %7D%0A %0A %7D catch %7B%0A push @%7B$validation-%3E%7Bissues%7D%7D, %22Cannot access Ency schema tables: $_%22;%0A %7D;%0A %0A # Check for required relationships%0A eval %7B%0A my $users_count = $ency_schema-%3Eresultset('User::User')-%3Ecount;%0A if ($users_count == 0) %7B%0A push @%7B$validation-%3E%7Bwarnings%7D%7D, %22No users found in Ency schema - migration will use default user IDs%22;%0A %7D%0A %7D catch %7B%0A push @%7B$validation-%3E%7Bwarnings%7D%7D, %22Cannot access User table in Ency schema%22;%0A %7D;%0A%7D%0A%0A# Generate data analysis%0Asub analyze_data_patterns %7B%0A print %22Analyzing data patterns...%5Cn%22;%0A %0A my $pages = $forager_schema-%3Eresultset('Page')-%3Esearch(%7B%7D);%0A %0A # Analyze field usage%0A my $field_stats = %7B%0A newsletter =%3E 0,%0A linkedin =%3E 0,%0A mailchimp =%3E 0,%0A comments =%3E 0,%0A view_name =%3E 0%0A %7D;%0A %0A while (my $page = $pages-%3Enext) %7B%0A $field_stats-%3E%7Bnewsletter%7D++ if $page-%3Enewsletter;%0A $field_stats-%3E%7Blinkedin%7D++ if $page-%3Elinkedin;%0A $field_stats-%3E%7Bmailchimp%7D++ if $page-%3Emailchimp;%0A $field_stats-%3E%7Bcomments%7D++ if $page-%3Ecomments;%0A $field_stats-%3E%7Bview_name%7D++ if $page-%3Eview_name;%0A %7D%0A %0A # Report on fields that will be dropped%0A for my $field (keys %25$field_stats) %7B%0A if ($field_stats-%3E%7B$field%7D %3E 0) %7B%0A push @%7B$validation-%3E%7Bwarnings%7D%7D, %0A %22Field '$field' has data in %22 . $field_stats-%3E%7B$field%7D . %22 records but will be dropped/consolidated%22;%0A %7D%0A %7D%0A %0A # +1,2626 @@\n+-- New pages table for Ency schema%0A-- Migrated from Forager page table with normalized structure%0A%0ACREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS pages (%0A id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,%0A title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL COMMENT 'Page title (migrated from app_title)',%0A content_id INT NULL COMMENT 'Foreign key to content table',%0A page_code VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL COMMENT 'Unique page code identifier',%0A status VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL COMMENT 'Page status',%0A share VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL COMMENT 'Page sharing settings',%0A link_order INT NOT NULL DEFAULT 0 COMMENT 'Order for page links',%0A news INT NOT NULL DEFAULT 0 COMMENT 'News flag',%0A last_modified_by INT NULL COMMENT 'User ID who last modified the page',%0A last_modified_at DATETIME NULL COMMENT 'Timestamp of last modification',%0A social_media TEXT NULL COMMENT 'JSON field for social media settings',%0A created_at DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'Timestamp when page was created',%0A %0A -- Constraints%0A UNIQUE KEY unique_page_code (page_code),%0A %0A -- Indexes%0A INDEX idx_pages_status (status),%0A INDEX idx_pages_content_id (content_id),%0A INDEX idx_pages_last_modified_by (last_modified_by),%0A INDEX idx_pages_link_order (link_order),%0A INDEX idx_pages_created_at (created_at),%0A %0A -- Foreign key constraints (add after related tables are created)%0A CONSTRAINT fk_pages_content %0A FOREIGN KEY (content_id) REFERENCES content(id) %0A ON DELETE SET NULL ON UPDATE CASCADE,%0A CONSTRAINT fk_pages_last_modified_by %0A FOREIGN KEY (last_modified_by) REFERENCES users(id) %0A ON DELETE SET NULL ON UPDATE CASCADE%0A %0A) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8mb4 COLLATE=utf8mb4_unicode_ci %0ACOMMENT='Pages table for Ency schema - stores page metadata and relationships';%0A%0A-- Migration tracking table%0ACREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS page_migration_log (%0A id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,%0A forager_record_id INT NOT NULL COMMENT 'Original record_id from Forager page table',%0A ency_page_id INT NOT NULL COMMENT 'New page ID in Ency schema',%0A ency_content_id INT NOT NULL COMMENT 'Associated content ID in Ency schema',%0A migrated_at DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'When migration occurred',%0A migration_notes TEXT NULL COMMENT 'Any notes about the migration',%0A %0A INDEX idx_migration_forager_id (forager_record_id),%0A INDEX idx_migration_ency_page_id (ency_page_id),%0A INDEX idx_migration_date (migrated_at)%0A %0A) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8mb4 COLLATE=utf8mb4_unicode_ci %0ACOMMENT='Tracks the migration
