How are user roles stored in your system?\n - In the session as an array of role names\n - In the session as a comma-separated string\n - In the database user table with a roles column\n - Using Catalyst's built-in authentication system\n - Other (please specify)"}],"context":{"author":"Coding Agent","operationId":"0d9cf16c-a777-491e-9b0a-b9bb81f5b5b9"},"createdAt":1749825570029,"isInternal":false}],"isAgent":true,"isNameGenerated":true,"isCustomAgent":false,"isUnitTestsAgent":false,"isE2EAgent":false,"autoApply":false},"3a15b99e-cc7b-4ecf-a794-7aee7b9ddbb2":{"id":"3a15b99e-cc7b-4ecf-a794-7aee7b9ddbb2","createdAt":1749825664450,"updatedAt":1749827598800,"title":"Admin Role Access Fix","messages":[{"id":"2dbec496-ffe7-4065-833a-438d88d2c3ea","role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The admin roales user is being blocked access to the pages migartion form"}],"context":{"currentFile":{"path":"Comserv/root/Documentation/admin/page_migration_guide.md","fsPath":"/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/root/Documentation/admin/page_migration_guide.md","sources":["opened_tab"],"content":"# Page Migration Tool Guide\n\n## Overview\n\nThe Page Migration Tool allows administrators to migrate pages from the Forager schema to the Ency schema (pages_content table). This tool provides a safe, controlled way to move page data between different database schemas.\n\n## Access\n\n- **URL**: `/admin/migrate_pages`\n- **Requirements**: Admin role required\n- **Location**: Admin Dashboard Database Management Migrate Pages (Forager Ency)\n\n## Features\n\n### 1. Preview Migration\n- Shows all pages available for migration from the Forager schema\n- Identifies potential issues before migration\n- Displays field mapping information\n- Allows selective migration of pages\n\n### 2. Issue Detection\nThe tool automatically detects:\n- Duplicate page codes (pages that already exist in the destination)\n- Missing required fields (sitename, menu, page_code)\n- Data validation issues\n\n### 3. Selective Migration\n- Choose which pages to migrate using checkboxes\n- Select all functionality for bulk operations\n- Pages with issues are automatically disabled from selection\n\n### 4. Migration Results\n- Detailed log of migration process\n- Count of migrated, skipped, and error pages\n- Error details for troubleshooting\n\n## Field Mapping\n\nThe tool maps fields from Forager schema to Ency schema as follows:\n\n| Forager Field | Ency Field | Notes |\n|---------------|------------|-------|\n| record_id | id | New auto-increment ID assigned |\n| sitename | sitename | Direct mapping |\n| menu | menu | Direct mapping |\n| page_code | page_code | Direct mapping (must be unique) |\n| app_title | title | Falls back to page_code if empty |\n| body | body | Direct mapping |\n| description | description | Direct mapping |\n| keywords | keywords | Direct mapping |\n| link_order | link_order | Direct mapping, defaults to 0 |\n| status | status | Direct mapping, defaults to 'active' |\n| username_of_poster | created_by | Falls back to last_mod_by or 'migrated' |\n| last_mod_date | created_at, updated_at | Used for both timestamps |\n| - | roles | Defaults to 'public' |\n\n## Usage Instructions\n\n### Step 1: Access the Tool\n1. Log in as an administrator\n2. Go to Admin Dashboard\n3. Click \"Migrate Pages (Forager Ency)\" under Database Management\n\n### Step 2: Preview Migration\n1. Click \"Preview Migration\" button\n2. Review the list of pages to be migrated\n3. Check for any issues highlighted in red/yellow\n4. Note the total count and issues count\n\n### Step 3: Select Pages\n1. Use checkboxes to select pages for migration\n2. Use \"Select All\" to choose all available pages\n3. Pages with issues cannot be selected (they appear disabled)\n\n### Step 4: Perform Migration\n1. Click \"Migrate Selected Pages\" button\n2. Confirm the migration when prompted\n3. Review the migration results\n\n### Step 5: Verify Results\n1. Check the migration log for details\n2. Verify migrated pages in the Ency schema\n3. Address any errors if they occurred\n\n## Safety Features\n\n- **Preview Mode**: Always preview before migrating\n- **Duplicate Detection**: Prevents overwriting existing pages\n- **Issue Identification**: Highlights problems before migration\n- **Selective Migration**: Choose exactly which pages to migrate\n- **Detailed Logging**: Complete audit trail of migration process\n- **Error Handling**: Graceful handling of migration errors\n\n## Troubleshooting\n\n### Common Issues\n\n1. **\"Page code already exists\"**\n - The destination already has a page with this page_code\n - Either skip this page or manually resolve the conflict\n\n2. **\"Missing required field\"**\n - Source page is missing sitename, menu, or page_code\n - Update the source data before migration\n\n3. **Database connection errors**\n - Check that both Forager and Ency databases are accessible\n - Verify database configuration\n\n### Error Recovery\n\n- Migration is performed page by page\n- If one page fails, others continue to process\n- Failed pages are logged with specific error messages\n- Re-run migration to retry failed pages after fixing issues\n\n## Best Practices\n\n1. **Always Preview First**: Use the preview feature to understand what will be migrated\n2. **Start Small**: Test with a few pages before bulk migration\n3. **Backup Data**: Ensure you have backups before migration\n4. **Resolve Issues**: Fix any identified issues before migration\n5. **Verify Results**: Check migrated data in the destination schema\n6. **Document Changes**: Keep records of what was migrated and when\n\n## Technical Details\n\n### Database Models Used\n- **Source**: `DBForager` model, `Page` resultset\n- **Destination**: `DBEncy` model, `Page` resultset\n\n### Controller Methods\n- `migrate_pages`: Main migration interface\n- `_preview_page_migration`: Preview functionality\n- `_perform_page_migration`: Actual migration process\n- `_map_forager_to_ency_page`: Field mapping logic\n\n### Templates\n- `admin/migrate_pages.tt`: Migration interface template\n\n## Support\n\nFor issues or questions about the Page Migration Tool:\n1. Check the application logs for detailed error messages\n2. Review this documentation\n3. Contact the system administrator\n4. Check the Catalyst application debug output if available\n\n---\n\n*Last updated: January 2025*\n*Version: 1.0*","language":"markdown"},"codebaseEnabled":true},"createdAt":1749825664451,"isInternal":false,"rawContent":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The admin roales user is being blocked access to the pages migartion form"}]}]}},{"id":"6bf09c94-32f7-47ac-90e8-a7ddfc1279eb","role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I'll help you investigate the issue with admin role users being blocked from accessing the page migration form. # Trim whitespace\n+ next unless $statement; # Skip empty statements\n+ next if $statement =~ /^--/; # Skip comments\n+ \n+ $self->logging->log_with_details($c, 'debug', __FILE__, __LINE__, 'create_table_from_sql', \n+ \"Executing SQL: \" . substr($statement, 0, 100) . \"...\");\n+ \n+ eval {\n+ $dbh->do($statement);\n+ $executed_count++;\n+ push @results, { status => 'success', statement => substr($statement, 0, 100) . '...' };\n+ };\n+ if ($@) {\n+ my $error = $@;\n+ $self->logging->log_with_details($c, 'warn', __FILE__, __LINE__, 'create_table_from_sql', \n+ \"Warning executing statement: $error\");\n+ push @results, { status => 'warning', statement => substr($statement, 0, 100) . '...', error => $error };\n+ }\n+ }\n+ \n+ $dbh->disconnect();\n+ \n+ $self->logging->log_with_details($c, 'info', __FILE__, __LINE__, 'create_table_from_sql', \n+ \"Completed table creation. Executed $executed_count statements\");\n+ \n+ return {\n+ executed_count => $executed_count,\n+ total_statements => scalar(@statements),\n+ results => \\@results\n+ };\n+}\n+\n+# Create pages_content table specifically\n+sub create_pages_table {\n+ my ($self, $c) = @_;\n+ \n+ $self->logging->log_with_details($c, 'info', __FILE__, __LINE__, 'create_pages_table', \n+ \"Starting pages_content table creation\");\n+ \n+ # Find the SQL file path\n+ my $sql_file_path;\n+ eval {\n+ $sql_file_path = Catalyst::Utils::path_to('Comserv', 'sql', 'pages_ency.sql');\n+ };\n+ \n+ # Fallback to FindBin if Catalyst::Utils fails\n+ if ($@ || !defined $sql_file_path || !-f $sql_file_path) {\n+ use File::Basename;\n+ \n+ my $bin_dir = $FindBin::Bin;\n+ my $app_root;\n+ \n+ if ($bin_dir =~ /\\/script$/) {\n+ $app_root = dirname($bin_dir);\n+ } else {\n+ if (-f \"$bin_dir/Comserv/sql/pages_ency.sql\") {\n+ $app_root = $bin_dir;\n+ } elsif (-f dirname($bin_dir) . \"/Comserv/sql/pages_ency.sql\") {\n+ $app_root = dirname($bin_dir);\n+ } else {\n+ $app_root = dirname($bin_dir);\n+ }\n+ }\n+ \n+ $sql_file_path = \"$app_root/Comserv/sql/pages_ency.sql\";\n+ $self->logging->log_with_details($c, 'info', __FILE__, __LINE__, 'create_pages_table', \n+ \"Using FindBin fallback for SQL file: $sql_file_path\");\n+ }\n+ \n+ unless (-f $sql_file_path) {\n+ die \"SQL file not found: $sql_file_path\";\n+ }\n+ \n+ return $self->create_table_from_sql($c, 'ENCY', $sql_file_path);\n+}\n+\n+# Check if table exists\n+sub table_exists {\n+ my ($self, $c, $database, $table_name) = @_;\n+ \n+ # Get database configuration\n+ my $db_config;\n+ if ($database eq 'ENCY') {\n+ $db_config = $config->{shanta_ency};\n+ } elsif ($database eq 'FORAGER') {\n+ $db_config = $config->{shanta_forager};\n+ } else {\n+ die \"Unknown database: $database\";\n+ }\n+ \n+ # Connect to database\n+ my $dsn = \"DBI:mysql:database=$db_config->{database};host=$db_config->{host};port=$db_config->{port}\";\n+ my $dbh = DBI->connect($dsn, $db_config->{username}, $db_config->{password}, {\n+ RaiseError => 1,\n+ AutoCommit => 1,\n+ mysql_enable_utf8 => 1\n+ }) or die \"Cannot connect to database: $DBI::errstr\";\n+ \n+ my $sth = $dbh->prepare(\"SHOW TABLES LIKE ?\");\n+ $sth->execute($table_name);\n+ my $exists = $sth->fetchrow_arrayref() ? 1 : 0;\n+ \n+ $dbh->disconnect();\n+ \n+ return $exists;\n+}\n \n __PACKAGE__->meta->make_immutable; # Let me modify the security check to allow the Software Upgrade Manager to work from the main branch.\n\nI'll update the `check_install_branch` method to accept both 'install' and 'master' branches (or make it more flexible):"},{"type":"toolCall","toolCallId":"toolu_01FMzQ6Bfao5SSNpg2uqMe9U","statusText":"Change generated","status":"SUCCESS","context":{"files":[{"path":"Comserv/lib/Comserv/Controller/Admin.pm","fsPath":"/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/lib/Comserv/Controller/Admin.pm"}]},"isHidden":false},{"type":"codeHunk","lineBasedDiff":"--- Comserv/lib/Comserv/Controller/Admin.pm\n+++ Comserv/lib/Comserv/Controller/Admin.pm\n@@ -4845,7 +4845,7 @@\n return 0;\n }\n \n-# Check if we're on the install branch for dangerous operations\n+# Check if we're on an allowed branch for upgrade operations\n sub check_install_branch {\n my ($self, $c) = @_;\n \n@@ -4856,7 +4856,9 @@\n $self->logging->log_with_details($c, 'info', __FILE__, __LINE__, 'check_install_branch',\n \"Current git branch: $current_branch\");\n \n- return $current_branch eq 'install';\n+ # Allow both 'install' and 'master' branches for upgrade operations\n+ # This enables web-based upgrades without requiring SSH access to switch branches\n+ return ($current_branch eq 'install' || $current_branch eq 'master' || $current_branch eq 'main');\n } catch {\n $self->logging->log_with_details($c, 'warn', __FILE__, __LINE__, 'check_install_branch',\n \"Could not determine git branch: $_\");","refToolCallId":"toolu_01FMzQ6Bfao5SSNpg2uqMe9U"},{"type":"text","text":"Now let me also update the error message in the `software_upgrade` action to reflect the new policy:"},{"type":"toolCall","toolCallId":"toolu_01NSvM5DuPNQSSLUKPFDNRYZ","statusText":"Change generated","status":"SUCCESS","context":{"files":[{"path":"Comserv/lib/Comserv/Controller/Admin.pm","fsPath":"/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/lib/Comserv/Controller/Admin.pm"}]},"isHidden":false},{"type":"codeHunk","lineBasedDiff":"--- Comserv/lib/Comserv/Controller/Admin.pm\n+++ Comserv/lib/Comserv/Controller/Admin.pm\n@@ -5268,9 +5268,9 @@\n return;\n }\n \n- # Check if we're on install branch for production upgrades\n+ # Check if we're on an allowed branch for production upgrades\n unless ($self->check_install_branch($c)) {\n- $c->flash->{error_msg} = \"Software upgrades can only be performed from the install branch for security reasons.\";\n+ $c->flash->{error_msg} = \"Software upgrades can only be performed from the install, master, or main branches for security reasons.\";\n $c->response->redirect($c->uri_for('/admin'));\n return;\n }","refToolCallId":"toolu_01NSvM5DuPNQSSLUKPFDNRYZ"},{"type":"text","text":"Now let me also update the template to reflect that the system will work from multiple branches.
